item.title: Quick Tips for Data Cleaning in R

What to Expect I‚Äôm excited to share pro-tips that will expedite your process for cleaning and standardizing column names in your data; this is a critical yet sometimes overlooked step in the cleaning + tidying of data.

item.title: Examining Data with glimpse()
item.description: Let‚Äôs Dive into an Example I‚Äôm a nerd ü§ì when it comes to programming (esp.¬†in R) and love learning about new functions. Matt Dancho, early in his Data Science Foundations with R Course, teaches students the importance of examining data before diving into wrangling and exploring it further. One of the functions I‚Äôve adopted from the course is the glimpse() function - it‚Äôs awesome and I use it all the time!

item.title: Advanced Plots with str_glue()
item.description: Enter your Email Here to receive notifications when new content is posted. Let‚Äôs Dive Into an Example I‚Äôd like to share a technique using str_glue() that I learned from Matt Dancho, a Data-Science instructor at Business Science University. Check out my favorite course here: Business Analysis With R. str_glue() from the stringr library is one of my favorite functions in R - It‚Äôs super helpful for wrangling and manipulating text in preparation for building advanced plots.
